727782f-a.text:
Queens Boulevard, west side, between 82nd Road and 82nd Avenue, showing Muller's Gold Fish Pond. The old boundary line between Newton and Jamaica passed through this pond. Mr. Armbruster states that it was located near Peter Opper's Hotel, on the south side of 82nd Avenue, just west of the Boulevard.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection  July 17, 1897

727781f-b.text:
Queens Boulevard, east side, from 82nd Avenue to Union Turnpike, showing, under construction, the new Queens Borough Hall on property formerly belonging to Sarah Palmer. It was opened December 4, 1940. View 1 is north from 82nd Avenue; view 2, south from Union Turnpike; and view 3 shows the rear, seen fm point east on the Turnpike. For additional data see
"The New York Times," December 4, 1940.

P. L. Sperr         View 1: August 11, 1940
Views 2,3: July 7, 1940

725668f-a.text:
121-15 82nd Avenue, north side, east of Queens Boulevard, showing a modern 2 1/2 story dwelling. The view is north from 82nd Road.

P. L. Sperr  June 29, 1936

726612f-a.text:
Flushing Meadow Park (Queens): A general view north across the Flushing meadows from Queens Boulevard, at 82nd Avenue, showing the site of the New York World's Fair 1939-40. Note the car yards of the Independent System Subway, at the lower end of the
park.

Vtew 2 is northeastward across the artificially created lakes, which later became part of the Fair's amusement center,
from Grand Central Parkway and 76th Road.

View 1: June 29, 1936
View 2: February 10, 1937

P. L. Sperr

Flushing Meadow Park (Queens): A general view north across the Flushing meadows from Queens Boulevard, at 82nd Avenue, showing the site of the New York World's Fair 1939-40. Note the car yards of the Independent System Subway, at the lower end of the

727783f-a.text:
Queens Boulevard, eas side, from 82nd Avenue to Union Turnpike,
showing the new Queens Borough Hall.

P. L. Sperr                July 23, 1941

727784f-b.text:
Queens Boulevard,west of the S.E. corner of Eighty-second Ave.
(left, delivery truck thereon), showing Opper's Roadhouse erected in 1905 by Peter Opper one hundred feet west of the old Opper Hotel, which stood on the opposite side of the road.  View No 2. shows also modern apartments in the background.

1922
View 2: October 1928.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

A6: Neg. # 4807
A7: Neg. # 4805
